ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent course for foundational theory and perspectives in medical anthropology. Texts are challenging, but rich. Professor Brotherton is a wonderful teacher.
This class is reading intensive, and cannot be overstated so choose your courses wisely when adding this to it. Beyond this, it was very enlightening and you will learn a lot.
Definitely a necessary course for any medical anthropology graduate student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I have a much better sense of the evolution of ideas about the body, health, and life itself. I also have a greater knowledge of the different writings on the subject and the ways in which people have engaged with and contested prevailing logics and assumptions.
